headline: Harden Your Systems: Today's Focus Areas

digest_items.title: Use environment variables for secrets
digest_items.why: Hardcoded secrets in code are exposed in version control
digest_items.fix: Store secrets in .env files (gitignored) or secret management services

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Use HSTS headers
digest_items.why: HTTP Strict Transport Security forces browsers to only connect via HTTPS

digest_items.title: Verify CORS configuration
digest_items.why: Misconfigured CORS can allow unauthorized cross-origin requests
digest_items.fix: Explicitly whitelist allowed origins instead of using '*'

digest_items.title: Use secure random number generation
digest_items.fix: Use crypto.randomBytes() or secrets module, not Math.random()

digest_items.title: Remove default credentials
digest_items.why: Default passwords are publicly known and exploited by automated scanners
digest_items.fix: Change all default passwords immediately after deployment

digest_items.title: Use security linters in CI/CD
digest_items.why: Automated security checks catch vulnerabilities before deployment
digest_items.fix: Integrate tools like Bandit (Python), ESLint security plugin (JS)

digest_items.title: Verify API versioning strategy
digest_items.why: Deprecated API versions may have unpatched vulnerabilities
digest_items.fix: Maintain clear deprecation timeline and force upgrades for old versions
